items.prompt: What is the 'Subject line'?
options: The person who receives the email
items.explanation: The subject line tells the receiver what the email is about.

items.prompt: Where do you write the main message?
items.explanation: The 'body' of the email contains the main content.

items.prompt: What is the 'Inbox'?
items.explanation: The Inbox is where you find your received emails.

items.prompt: Which of these is a folder for unfinished emails?
items.explanation: Drafts are emails that you started but did not send yet.

items.prompt: What is an 'Attachment'?
options: A file sent with the email
items.explanation: An attachment is a document or file included in the email.

items.prompt: How do you call the greeting at the start of an email?
items.explanation: Salutation is the formal word for a greeting.

items.prompt: Which folder contains emails you have already mailed?
items.explanation: The 'Sent' folder stores messages you have mailed.

items.prompt: What is 'Reply' used for?
options: To send to a new person
items.explanation: 'Reply' is used to write back to the sender.

items.prompt: What is 'Forward' used for?
options: To send the email to a new recipient
items.explanation: 'Forward' sends the message to another person.

items.prompt: Where is your name and contact info located?
items.explanation: The signature at the end contains your professional details.

items.prompt: Which of these is a common 'Closing'?
items.explanation: 'Best regards' is a standard professional closing.

items.prompt: What does 'CC' mean in an email?
items.explanation: CC stands for Carbon Copy, used to send a copy to someone else.

items.prompt: Which one is a formal salutation?
items.explanation: 'Dear [Name]' is the most formal way to start a professional email.

items.prompt: The 'Recipient' is the person who:
items.explanation: The recipient is the 'To:' person in the email.

items.prompt: What should the 'Subject line' be?
items.explanation: Professional subject lines must be concise and descriptive.

items.prompt: Complete: 'Please ________ the attached file.'
items.explanation: You can ask someone to 'find' or 'open' an attachment.

items.prompt: Which is an informal closing?
items.explanation: 'Cheers' is used in informal or friendly business emails.

items.prompt: When do you use 'Dear Sir/Madam'?
options: When you know the person well
When you don't know the name of the person
items.explanation: Use 'Dear Sir/Madam' if you don't have a specific contact name.

items.prompt: The 'BCC' field is used to:
options: Send to a group visible to all
Send a blind copy (hidden from others)
items.explanation: BCC (Blind Carbon Copy) hides recipients from each other.

items.prompt: What is a 'Thread' in email?
items.explanation: An email thread is the history of the conversation.

items.prompt: Choose the correct spelling:
items.explanation: The correct spelling is A-T-T-A-C-H-M-E-N-T.

items.prompt: What does 'ASAP' mean in an email?
items.explanation: ASAP is a common acronym for 'as soon as possible'.

items.prompt: Identify the 'Salutation':
items.explanation: 'Dear Team' is a group salutation.

items.prompt: Where is the '@' symbol used?
items.explanation: The '@' (at) symbol is essential for email addresses.

items.prompt: What is 'Spam'?
items.explanation: Spam refers to unsolicited commercial or junk mail.

items.prompt: Which button creates a NEW message?
items.explanation: 'Compose' (or 'New Email') is the button to start a fresh message.

items.prompt: What is the 'Footer' of an email?
items.explanation: The footer is the area at the bottom of the email.

items.prompt: Which is more formal?
items.explanation: 'Dear [Title] [Last Name]' is the most formal.

items.prompt: What is 'Out of Office' (OOO)?
options: An automatic reply when you are away
items.explanation: OOO is an automated message when you are on vacation or away.

items.prompt: How do you say '.' in an email address?
items.explanation: In email/web contexts, we say 'dot'.

items.prompt: The ________ (asunto) of the email is 'Project Update'.
items.explanation: 'Subject' translates to 'asunto' in the context of emails.

items.prompt: I am sending a PDF ________ (archivo adjunto).
items.explanation: 'Attachment' is the standard term for a file sent with an email.

items.prompt: Please ________ (responder) to this message by Friday.
items.explanation: 'Reply' is the action of answering an email.

items.prompt: Check your ________ (bandeja de entrada) for new messages.
items.explanation: The 'inbox' is where received emails arrive.

items.prompt: Your professional ________ (firma) should include your phone number.
items.explanation: The 'signature' is the contact block at the end of an email.

items.prompt: Can you ________ (reenviar) this email to the manager?
items.explanation: 'Forward' means sending an existing email to a third person.

items.prompt: I have an unfinished email in my ________ (borradores).
items.explanation: 'Drafts' are saved but unsent messages.

items.prompt: The email ________ (cuerpo) contains the main details.
items.explanation: The 'body' is the main text area of the email.

items.prompt: Don't forget the ________ (saludo) like 'Dear Mr. Brown'.
items.explanation: Salutation (or greeting) is the start of the email.

items.prompt: Click '________' (redactar) to start a new message.
items.explanation: 'Compose' is the button used to create a new email.

items.prompt: Type the ________ (dirección) of the recipient in the 'To' field.
items.explanation: You need the email 'address' to send a message.

items.prompt: Wait, I need to ________ (borrar) this junk mail.
items.explanation: 'Delete' removes the email from your inbox.

items.prompt: The ________ (carpeta) for deleted items is the Trash.
items.explanation: 'Folder' is a directory in your email account.

items.prompt: I will ________ (enviar) the report now.
items.explanation: 'Send' is the verb for mailing the message.

items.prompt: 'Best regards' is a professional ________ (despedida).
items.explanation: A 'closing' ends the email professionally.

items.prompt: Match the email parts with their Spanish meanings:
items.explanation: These are the main structural components of a professional email.

items.prompt: Match the folders with their content:
items.explanation: Each folder has a specific function in email management.

items.prompt: Match the actions with their purpose:
items.explanation: These verbs describe common email actions.

items.prompt: Match the salutations with the context:
items.explanation: Salutations change based on formality and the recipient.

items.prompt: Match the closings with their style:
items.explanation: Closings should match the tone of the entire email.

items.prompt: Match the abbreviations with their meanings:
items.explanation: Abbreviations are common in professional email shorthand.

items.prompt: Match the punctuation with its email term:
items.explanation: Correct pronunciation of symbols is important for sharing email addresses.

items.prompt: Match the email fields with what you enter:
items.explanation: These fields define the metadata of the email.

items.prompt: Match the email statuses:
items.explanation: Icons and labels help organize your inbox by status.

items.prompt: Match the professional roles with typical email needs:
items.explanation: Email is a tool used differently by different professionals.

items.title: A New Email
items.text:
From: sarah.lee@office.com
To: mark.jones@office.com
Subject: Project Report

Dear Mark,

Please find the project report attached to this email. Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards,
Sarah Lee
Administrator

questions.question: What is the subject of the email?
questions.explanation: The 'Subject' line clearly states 'Project Report'.

questions.question: Who is the recipient?
questions.explanation: The email is addressed 'To: mark.jones@office.com'.

items.title: Email Management
items.text: John is very busy today. His inbox has 50 unread messages. He needs to reply to his boss first. Then, he must forward the invoice to the accounting department. Finally, he will delete the spam messages.

questions.question: What is John's first task?
questions.explanation: The text says he needs to reply to his boss first.

questions.question: How many new messages does he have?
questions.explanation: He has 50 'unread' (new) messages.

items.title: Drafting an Email
items.text: When you write a professional email, always start with a salutation. Use 'Dear' for formal messages. Write the main information in the body. End with a closing like 'Best regards'. Finally, add your signature with your name and job title.

questions.question: What should you use for formal messages?
questions.explanation: The text recommends 'Dear' for formal messages.

questions.question: Where do you put your name and job title?
questions.explanation: The signature contains your name and title.

items.title: The Wrong Address
items.text: Alice sent an email to bob@office.con. The email did not arrive because the address was wrong. It should be bob@office.com. Alice needs to check the 'Sent' folder and resend the message correctly.

questions.question: Why did the email not arrive?
questions.explanation: She wrote '.con' instead of '.com'.

questions.question: Where can Alice find the email she tried to send?
questions.explanation: Emails you attempt to send are stored in the 'Sent' folder.

items.title: Email Security
items.text: Be careful with your email password. Never share it with anyone. If you receive a strange email with an attachment from a stranger, do not open it. It could be a virus. Delete it immediately and report it as spam.

questions.question: Should you share your password?
questions.explanation: The text says 'Never share it with anyone'.

questions.question: What should you do with a strange attachment?
questions.explanation: You should not open strange attachments to avoid viruses.

items.title: The CC Field
items.text: I am sending the invoice to the client. I am also putting my manager in the CC field. This way, my manager can see the email too. The client is the main recipient, and the manager receives a copy.

questions.question: Who is the main recipient?
questions.explanation: The text says 'sending... to the client'.

questions.question: Why is the manager in the CC field?
questions.explanation: CC is used to send a copy to another person.

items.title: Subject Line Importance
items.text: A good subject line is very important. It helps the receiver understand the message quickly. For example, use 'Meeting at 10 AM' instead of just 'Hello'. If the subject is clear, people open the email faster.

questions.question: What is the benefit of a good subject line?
options: It helps the receiver understand quickly
questions.explanation: A clear subject line communicates the topic immediately.

questions.question: Which subject line is better?
questions.explanation: 'Meeting at 10 AM' is specific and professional.

items.title: Automated Replies
items.text: When employees go on vacation, they set an 'Out of Office' reply. This is an automatic message. It tells people: 'I am not in the office. I will reply when I return.' It usually includes the date of return.

questions.question: When do you use an 'Out of Office' reply?
questions.explanation: It is used when you are away from work.

questions.question: What information does it usually include?
questions.explanation: It informs others when you will be back.

items.title: Email Signatures
items.text: Company policy requires a standard signature. It must have your full name, your job title, the company logo, and your phone number. Do not use informal colors or many different fonts. Keep it professional and simple.

questions.question: What must be included in the signature?
questions.explanation: Phone number is listed as a requirement.

questions.question: How should the signature look?
questions.explanation: The text advises to 'Keep it professional and simple'.

items.title: The Forward Action
items.text: I received an email from a client with a technical problem. I don't know the answer. I will forward the email to the IT department. They can help the client better than me.

questions.question: Why is the person forwarding the email?
options: Because they don't know the answer
questions.explanation: The sender forwards it to someone who can solve the problem.

questions.question: Who will receive the forwarded email?
questions.explanation: The email is being sent to IT.

items.title: Listening: Checking the Inbox
items.transcript: Speaker: Hi Maria, did you check the inbox? We have a new email from the director. The subject is 'Emergency Meeting'. Please reply to him immediately.

questions.question: Who sent the new email?
questions.explanation: The transcript says 'from the director'.

questions.question: What is the subject of the email?
questions.explanation: The subject is explicitly mentioned as 'Emergency Meeting'.

items.title: Listening: Sending an Attachment
items.transcript: Speaker: Hello, this is David. I am sending you the contract now. I am attaching it as a PDF. Please confirm when you receive the attachment.

questions.question: What is David sending?
questions.explanation: David says 'I am sending you the contract'.

questions.question: In what format is the file?
questions.explanation: He mentions 'attaching it as a PDF'.

items.title: Listening: Forwarding a Message
items.transcript: Speaker: Oh, I see an email from the HR department. It's about the new office rules. I will forward it to the whole team so everyone can read it.

questions.question: Which department sent the email?
questions.explanation: The speaker mentions the 'HR department'.

questions.question: What will the speaker do with the email?
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'I will forward it'.

items.title: Listening: Email Problems
items.transcript: Speaker: I can't send any emails today! My 'Sent' folder is empty and I keep getting error messages. I think the server is down. I need to call IT Support.

questions.question: What is the problem?
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'I think the server is down'.

questions.question: Who will the speaker call?
questions.explanation: The speaker needs to call IT Support for technical help.

items.title: Listening: Formal vs Informal
items.transcript: Speaker: When you email Mr. Henderson, remember to be formal. Use 'Dear Mr. Henderson' and end with 'Sincerely'. Don't just say 'Hi'.

questions.question: How should the email to Mr. Henderson be?
questions.explanation: The speaker explicitly says 'remember to be formal'.

questions.question: Which closing is recommended?
questions.explanation: The speaker suggests using 'Sincerely'.

items.title: Listening: Junk Mail
items.transcript: Speaker: Ugh, my inbox is full of junk! I have ten emails about winning a lottery and five about cheap watches. I'm going to mark them all as spam.

questions.question: What kind of emails did the speaker receive?
questions.explanation: Lottery and sales emails are 'junk'.

questions.question: What action will the speaker take?
questions.explanation: The speaker is going to 'mark them all as spam'.

items.title: Listening: The Draft Folder
items.transcript: Speaker: I started writing the reply to the client yesterday, but I didn't finish it. It's in my 'Drafts' folder. I will finish it and send it now.

questions.question: Why is the email in the 'Drafts' folder?
questions.explanation: Drafts are for unfinished, unsent messages.

questions.question: When did the speaker start the email?
questions.explanation: The transcript says 'started... yesterday'.

items.title: Listening: Dictating an Email Address
items.transcript: Speaker: My email is info at office dot com. That's I-N-F-O, then the 'at' symbol, O-F-F-I-C-E, then dot, then C-O-M.

questions.question: What is the first part of the address?
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'info at...'

questions.question: What does 'dot' represent?
questions.explanation: In email addresses, 'dot' is the period symbol.

items.title: Listening: Subject Line Request
items.transcript: Speaker: Please, when you send me the files, use a clear subject line. Put your name and the word 'Documents'. It helps me find your email later.

questions.question: What does the speaker want in the subject line?
questions.explanation: The speaker asks for 'name and the word Documents'.

questions.question: Why is this important?
questions.explanation: It helps organize and locate the email in a busy inbox.

items.title: Listening: Signature Update
items.transcript: Speaker: Team, please update your signatures. We have a new company logo. You can find the new logo file in the shared folder. Attach it to your signature by Friday.

questions.question: What needs to be updated?
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'update your signatures'.

questions.question: What is new?
questions.explanation: The company has a new logo to include in signatures.
